data.benefits: BIRAC provides grant-in-aid of upto Rs. 50 lakhs (approx USD 75,000) for a period of 18 months.
data.eligibility:
Individual Applicants: 

  1. Must be Indian citizens. 
  2. Primary applicant should be the Project Leader. 
  3. Must be incubated in an incubator (can be anywhere in India, BIRAC-supported or not). 
  4. Letter of Intent (LoI)/Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the incubator required for final approval. 
  5. If employed/studying at an academic or research organization, they must provide a No Objection Certificate (NOC) permitting: 
  6. Acceptance of funding support as an individual. 
  7. Management of funds through a separate no-lien account. 
  8. Undertaking the project at an incubator. 
  9. Creation of an enterprise. 
  10. Alternatively, applicants must commit to resign from their current job/employment and submit proof of resignation/relieving/retirement before the grant approval. 
  11. Applicants associated with a biotech company/LLP as a promoter shareholder/partner cannot apply as individuals. 

Company/LLP Applicants: 

  1. Must be registered under the Indian Companies Act, 1956/2013. 
  2. Incorporation date must not exceed 5 years from the closing date of the BIG call. 
  3. At least 51% of the ownership should be with resident Indian citizens or Indian companies owned by them. 
  4. Application should be led by a Project Leader. 
  5. Must have a functional in-house R&D facility or be incubated at a verified incubator. 

Applicants will be ineligible if: 

  1. A promoter holding ≥20% shares is a co-promoter/partner in another ineligible company/LLP, unless the latter operates in a non-biotech domain. 
  2. A partner in an applicant LLP is also a partner/co-promoter in another ineligible LLP/company, unless the latter operates in a non-biotech domain.
data.conditions:
The project proposals can be submitted in any of the following seven categories:
  1. Devices & Diagnostics
  2. Drugs including drug delivery
  3. Industrial Biotechnology including Secondary Agriculture
  4. Agriculture
  5. Biosimilars & Stem Cells
  6. Vaccines
  7. Bioinformatics & facilities BIG grantees are required to pay 5% royalty on net sales of the product/technology developed through BIRAC support till the time such royalty payment becomes equivalent to the grant-in aid assistance disbursed by BIRAC for the Project.

data.prerequisites:
The project proposals can be submitted in any of the following seven categories:
  1. Devices & Diagnostics
  2. Drugs including drug delivery
  3. Industrial Biotechnology including Secondary Agriculture
  4. Agriculture
  5. Biosimilars & Stem Cells
  6. Vaccines
  7. Bioinformatics & facilities BIG grantees are required to pay 5% royalty on net sales of the product/technology developed through BIRAC support till the time such royalty payment becomes equivalent to the grant-in aid assistance disbursed by BIRAC for the Project.
data.context: The Biotechnology Ignition Grant (BIG) is a flagship scheme of BIRAC which recognizes and invests in innovative ideas in the biotech sector. The ideas should have clear potential to translate into commercial products/ technologies. BIG supports individual entrepreneurs/ start-ups from ideation to Proof of Concept (PoC).
data.objective:
1. Supports ideation to proof of concept stage
  2. Nurtures entrepreneurship to enable translation of ideas into commercially viable products/technologies to address unmet need
  3. Enables Biotech Startup Ecosystem in the country to become globally competitive.
data.description:
1. Grant-in-aid upto Rs. 50 lakhs, where grant period is 18 months
  2. Mentoring support and Project Monitoring by BIG Partner
  3. Ignition Grant is for high level of innovation.
data.how_to_apply: Applicants can apply through below portal (https://innovative.msme.gov.in).
data.funding_mechanism:
The fund allocation is milestone based and released in 4 installments:
  • 1st Installment: Signing of Contract: upto 30%
  • 2ndInstallment: Completion of 1st Milestone (M1): 30%
  • 3rd Installment: Completion of 2nd Milestone (M2): 30%
  • 4th Installment: Completion of project and submission of final report (M4):
  • 5-10% Last installment is released after submission of project completion report.

This is typically in the nature of reimbursement.
data.additional_info: The proposed objectives and deliverables should not have received funding support from any other agency.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Self-Attested Copy of Udyam Registration 
2. Self-Attested Copy of Memorandum of Association  
3. Self-Attested Copy of Article of Association  
4. Self-Attested Copy of PAN Card of Enterprise and Applicant/ Promoters/ Directors/ partners and authorised signatory  
5. NOC of Parent Organization 
6. Self-Attested Copy of GST Registration (if applicable) 
7. Resume of Team Members 
8. Annual Report for Previous 3 Financial Year (if applicable) 
9. CA certified share holding pattern of the Company/Collaborators 
10. Shareholder Passport/Aadhar Card 
11. Company Registration Certificate 
12. Annual Report Of The Organization For The Previous Financial Year 
13. Memorandum of Understanding 
14. Patent/Patent Applied For/License Agreement 
15. Concerned Pollution Control Board Approval/ Consent 
16. Declaration Document 
17. Any Other Relevant Documents (if required) 
CA certified share holding pattern of the Company/Collaborators – 
https://birac.nic.in/formats/CA_Certified_Shareholding_Pattern_new.doc 

Declaration Document – 
https://birac.nic.in/formats/declaration.doc

data.beneficiary: Specific Industry  - Limited Liability Partnership (LLP), Private Limited Company, Public Company  - All Locations  - All MSMEs
